page.title: 01INTRODUCTION, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: We are class 3 of the Walter Powell Primary School,Great Somerford,Wilts. Our area of study covers Little Somerford village, Cleverton hamlet and part of Great Somerford.The nearest towns are Malmesbury,Wootton Bassett and Chippenham.The area population is approx.600, mostly living in Little Somerford. This is flat open grassland used for dairyfarming,its highest point being 91m.A.S.L. The soil is limestone and the water is "very hard". The area is crossed by the River Avon,the B4042 road and several minor roads, one leading to the M4. The main London to Bristol railway line bisects the area south of Little Somerford. We shall be looking at population and social features,a local farm,some significant buildings,and some local flora and fauna.
